articles.author: Aftab Ahmed, Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: Pakistan's armed forces launched "multiple attacks" using drones and other munitions along India's entire western border on Thursday night and early Friday, the Indian army said.
articles.title: Pakistan launched multiple attacks along India's western border, India says

articles.author: Philip Pullella, Joshua McElwee, Keith Weir
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV on Friday celebrated his first Mass in the Sistine Chapel where he was elected less than 24 hours earlier and prayed that his historic papacy can help the Catholic Church be a beacon illuminating "the dark nights of this world".
articles.title: New Pope Leo XIV vows to bring light to world's "dark nights"

articles.author: Antoni Slodkowski, Laurie Chen
articles.description: Re-engagement was complicated by the fractious nature of U.S.-China diplomacy.
articles.title: Inside China's decision to come to the table on Trump tariffs

articles.author: Ju-Min Park
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un made a rare visit to the Russian embassy in Pyongyang with his daughter on Friday to celebrate Russia's Victory Day to mark the Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany in World War Two, state media said.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim makes rare visit to Russian embassy as ties deepen

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia on Friday paraded combat drones that its forces use in the war in Ukraine on Moscow's Red Square in what state TV said was a first.
articles.title: Russia parades drones it uses against Ukraine on Moscow's Red Square

articles.author: Greg Torode
articles.description: China is gleaning data from its fighter jets and other weapons used in action by Pakistan.
articles.title: India-Pakistan conflict offers rich intelligence opportunity for China

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia marked the 80th anniversary of the Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany in World War Two on Friday with a major military parade that went off without any reports of Ukrainian attacks despite three years of devastating war.
articles.title: With Xi at his side, Putin marks WW2 victory as Ukraine war grinds on

articles.author: Kate Abnett
articles.description: The European Union's plans to cut back sustainability reporting rules could expose European companies to more climate change-related lawsuits, 31 legal scholars said in a letter published on Friday.
articles.title: EU changes to sustainability law risk company lawsuits, legal scholars say

articles.author: Jack Queen, Luc Cohen
articles.description: A jury of 12 New Yorkers is due to be chosen in the racketeering and sex trafficking trial of hip-hop mogul Sean “Diddy” Combs, who could face decades or even life in prison if convicted.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs jury to be seated in hip-hop mogul's sex trafficking trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Chinese embassies in India and Pakistan on Friday advised citizens to step up safety precautions and to be cautious about travelling to the South Asian countries, amidst the worst fighting in the region in nearly three decades.
articles.title: Chinese embassies in India, Pakistan, Nepal advise caution amid conflict
